beschrijving.nl:
De ondernemersopleiding bereidt u voor op de uitoefening van een zelfstandig beroep en het beheer van een kleine en middelgrote onderneming (kmo). De opleiding combineert een theoretische vorming in een SYNTRA-leercentrum met praktijkervaring, een praktijkstage of een aanvullende praktijkopleiding.

Wie slaagt in een module, krijgt een deelcertificaat uitgereikt. Wie ook de praktijkproef met succes aflegt, ontvangt het erkende getuigschrift van praktijk en beroepskennis ondernemersopleiding voor het betreffende beroep. Wie daarnaast ook nog de module basiskennis bedrijfsbeheer met goed gevolg doorloopt, ontvangt een diploma ondernemersopleiding. Dat diploma is erkend door het ministerie van de Vlaamse Gemeenschap en SYNTRA Vlaanderen.

beschrijving.nl:
De erkenning is vereist voor elk kantoor, ook als de maatschappelijke zetel van het hoofdbureau niet in het Vlaamse Gewest gevestigd is.

Private arbeidsbemiddelaars (selectiebureaus, artiestenbureaus, outplacementbureaus, headhunters...) kunnen hun diensten op de Vlaamse arbeidsmarkt aanbieden zonder dat ze daarvoor een erkenning moeten hebben.

Alle bedrijven die aan private arbeidsbemiddeling doen, ook als ze geen erkenning nodig hebben, moeten bij de uitoefening van hun activiteiten in het Vlaamse Gewest een aantal voorwaarden naleven. Uitzendbureaus moeten daarbovenop aan enkele specifieke bijkomende voorwaarden voldoen.

Die verplichtingen zijn bedoeld

  • ter bescherming van werknemers, werkzoekenden en gebruikers
  • ter voorkoming en bestrijding van oneerlijke concurrentie in de sector.

      • Het loopbaancentrum verklaart via een attest loopbaanbegeleiding dat de opleiding noodzakelijk is voor de uitvoering van het POP.

Vanaf 2 september 2021 geldt alleen de kwaliteitsregistratie WSE.

      • Het loopbaanattest mag maximaal 6 jaar oud zijn.

      • Je voegt het loopbaanattest samen met het inschrijvingsattest van de opleiding toe aan de aanvraag.

• You are an employee or temporary worker.
    Employees in both the private and public sectors are eligible.
    If you are in a situation of temporary unemployment, you are still under an employment contract with your employer and are eligible.
  • You live
    • in Flanders or in the Brussels-Capital Region
    • in a country other than Belgium that belongs to the EU or the EEA and you work in Flanders or the Brussels-Capital Region
    • in Wallonia, after you have moved there from another country (other than Belgium) that belongs to the EU or the EEA and you work in Flanders or in the Brussels-Capital Region.
  • You are following a training course at your own initiative and at your own expense.
  • You are:
    • low- or medium-skilled (you have at most a certificate of secondary education): in that case you can use a training voucher to pay for career-oriented training as well as all training courses registered in the ‘Training course database of Flemish training incentives'.
    • highly skilled (you have a graduate, bachelor’s or master’s degree): in that case you can only use a training voucher to pay for career-oriented training.

Which training courses?

You can use training vouchers to pay for:

  • a training course that is registered in the Training course database of Flemish training incentives
    • only valid if you have at most a certificate of secondary education (so only for low- or medium-skilled).
  • career-oriented training
    • applicable to low- medium- and highly skilled
    • career-oriented training is a course that is necessary to fullfill the personal development plan (Dutch: persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan/POP), the result of career guidance.
      • The career centre declares on a career guidance certificate that the training is necessary for the performance of the POP.
      • The training course lasts at least 32 hours.
      • The training provider must be registered as a qualified service provider. If, on 31 August 2019 at the latest, the training provider was recognised as a service provider for the SME portfolio or for training vouchers, it will be considered a qualified service provider until 2 September 2021. From 2 September 2021, only the WSE quality registration will be valid.
      • The career certificate may not be older than 6 years.
      • You should attach the career certificate and the training enrolment certificate to your application.

Commercial enterprises as well as non-profit organisations and public social welfare centres can apply for recognition. Your company can either carry out activities exclusively with service vouchers or in addition to other activities.

In order to become a recognised company, you must meet a number of conditions. For example, you must take part in an information session, pay a deposit of EUR 25,000 and add an accurate business plan in accordance with the regulations on service vouchers. General conditions also apply.

After obtaining recognition, you have to recruit employees who want to work as service voucher employees. They may also be foreign workers, provided they have a valid work permit. These employees must also meet certain conditions. Certain categories of employees may not be recruited through a service voucher employment contract. In addition, they may only perform a specific number of defined tasks.

beschrijving.en:
Employers

Any employer in the private and public sector (including non-profit organisations) who hires an employee at a place of business in the Flemish Region is eligible for the subsidy.

Employers of companies in difficulty are not eligible.

Employees

The employee must at the same time:

  • have been registered with VDAB as a non-working job seeker for at least 2 years upon entry into employment. Periods of short employment (less than three months), incapacity for work or imprisonment may be equated with periods as a job seeker.
  • be aged 25 or older and under 56 at the end of the quarter of entry into employment,
  • be granted an employment contract of indefinite duration, or equivalent (temporary employment contracts of at least 3 months are also eligible, if they are customary in the company's recruitment policy).
  • be working at a place of business in the Flemish Region
  • have an employment contract that took effect no earlier than 1 January 2017.

Not eligible: employees with a:

  • temporary employment contract
  • contract as a flexi-job employee
  • contract as a casual employee

The recruitment incentive cannot be combined with:

  • the salary incentive in the context of supported employment (sheltered and social workshops)
  • the remuneration in the context of local service economy
  • the salary incentive in the context of insertion companies (Dutch: invoegbedrijven).
